Interface ScriptImageStorage

All Superinterfaces:

public interface ScriptImageStorage
extends java.rmi.Remote

Author:
langmo

          Gets bit depth of last image.

          Returns how many bytes correspond to one pixel.

Method Detail

getLastImagePixels

java.lang.Object getLastImagePixels()
                                    throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Returns the pixels of the last image made.

Returns:
pixels of image.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException

getNewImagePixels

java.lang.Object getNewImagePixels(int timeout)
                                   throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Waits for new image data to arrive and returns the pixels of the newly arrived image. Makes only sense if job was started asynchrony.

Parameters:
timeout - Maximal time in ms to wait.
Returns:
pixels of image.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException

getLastImageBytesPerPixel

int getLastImageBytesPerPixel()
                              throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Returns how many bytes correspond to one pixel. Thus, gives - together with getLastImageCoding() - information on to which data type the result of getLastImagePixels() has to be converted.

Returns:
Bytes per pixel.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException

getLastImageCoding

java.lang.String getLastImageCoding()
                                    throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Returns a string describing the data type to which the result of getLastImagePixels() has to be converted.

Returns:
Data type of pixels.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException
